verses.roman:
svān svān bandhūn pariṣvajya
lakṣmaṇeṣubhir arditān
ruruduḥ susvaraṁ dīnā
ghnantya ātmānam ātmanā

synonyms: svān svān—their own respective husbands; bandhūn—friends; pariṣvajya—embracing; lakṣmaṇa-iṣubhiḥ—by the arrows of Lakṣmaṇa; arditān—who were killed; ruruduḥ—all the wives cried piteously; su-svaram—it was very sweet to hear; dīnāḥ—very poor; ghnantyaḥ—striking; ātmānam—their breasts; ātmanā—by themselves.
translation: Striking their breasts in affliction because their husbands had been killed by the arrows of Lakṣmaṇa, the women embraced their respective husbands and cried piteously in voices appealing to everyone.
